intro: Oxydectes longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive white or pale yellow center, forming a daisy-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
